newsitem.title: USA: PC Quote says auditors won't stand for re-election.
newsitem.headline: PC Quote says auditors won't stand for re-election.

text.p: PC Quote Inc said its independent accounting firm of McGladrey & Pullen LLP has declined to stand for re-election as the auditor for the company.
PC Quote provides on-line stock and market quotes to financial professionals, consumers and redistributors.

McGladrey & Pullen provided a letter to the Securities and Exchange Commission that its reports on PC Quote's financial statements for the past two fiscal years contained "no adverse opinions or disclaimer of opinion and were not qualified or modified as to uncertainty, audit scope or accounting principle, except for a going concern phrase," said Jim Porter, chief executive officer of PC Quote, in a news release.

In early April, PC Quote had issued a statement that its auditors had raised doubts about the company's ability to continue as a going concern due to significant operating losses. In February, PC Quote hired investment bank William Blair to & Co to help the company explore possible sale, merger, joint venture or other business options.
Porter, who was named president in mid-June, said PC Quote has already begun the process of choosing a new independent auditing firm.
He declined to provide further information on the auditors action.
Shares of PC Quote were trading off 1/16 to 2-3/8.
